adjective.description: Resembling a leaf; having parts resembling leaves.

noun.description: Botany. An organ resembling a leaf in form and function, though not considered homologous with a true leaf; a leaflike structure in an alga.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Robert Mayne (1808–1868). From ancient Greek ϕύλλον leaf + -oid, after post-classical Latin phylloideus.
